title: GCD-Intersecting Set
content: A set A where gcd(a,b) > 1 for all distinct a, b ∈ A. Every pair shares a common factor greater than 1.

title: Maximum GCD-Intersecting Size
content: maxGCDIntersecting(N) is the largest size of a GCD-intersecting subset of {1,...,N} that contains N.

title: Multiples of Smallest Prime
content: Taking all multiples of the smallest prime factor p gives a GCD-intersecting set of size N/p.

title: Original Conjecture False
content: The Erdős-Graham conjecture that max is N/p or #{even numbers sharing factor with N} is FALSE. Ahlswede-Khachatrian found counterexamples.

title: Ahlswede-Khachatrian Theorem
content: The maximum is achieved by integers divisible by elements from {2q₁,...,2qⱼ, q₁⋯qⱼ} for optimal j depending on N.

title: Prime Power Case
content: When N = p^k, the maximum is p^{k-1}. All elements must be divisible by p.

title: Erdős-Ko-Rado Connection
content: GCD > 1 is the arithmetic analogue of 'shares an element' in set intersection problems. This is an Erdős-Ko-Rado type result for integers.

title: Complete Characterization
content: Original conjecture is false, correct answer involves optimal j choice from the prime factorization structure.
